description:
"SHIVER" Pt. 4

The mysteries of Venom's appearance in the Arctic continue to be revealed!
name: Shiver Part 4

description:
"SHIVER" Pt. 5

Venom's killing spree comes to a head, as we learn more about his mysterious past.
name: Shiver Part 5

description:
RUN PART 1

On the loose from an Arctic research facility and pursued by a mysterious alien agent, Venom is headed to civilization. Hungry and craving adrenaline, Venom sets his sights on a tasty little snack -- the mutant Wolverine...

While Venom is is going Host to Host is now battling Wolverine that's right Wolverine vs Venom again since last time and this time he means business while he found Eddie Brock the real venom and now there are two of him what is going two Symbiotes and Wolverine is going to find out what's going on.
name: Run Part One

description: GUEST-STARRING WOLVERINE! On the loose from an Arctic research facility and pursued by a mysterious alien agent, Venom is headed to civilization. Hungry and craving adrenaline, Venom sets his sights on a tasty little snack? A short, hairy Canadian guy with a bad temper...
name: Run Part Two

description: "RUN" pt. 3 (of 5)-Guest-starring Wolverine. 'Nuff said...
name: Run Part Three

description:
"RUN" pt. 4 (of 5)

After blowing up the small Canadian town of Voice and all of Venom's potential hosts, Frankie and Vic are now able to flush out the elusive alien. But what they didn't count on is Wolverine surviving the blast!
name: Run Part Four

description:
RUN PART 5

What's the only thing worse than an adrenaline craving killer alien who can attach itself to any living thing on this planet? Answer: an adrenaline craving killer alien attached to Wolverine!

Wolverine and venom continue the fight it also makes Spider-man involved they are now finding out what is going on and also Eddie Brock makes his return with the venom symbiote
name: Run Part Five

description:
"PATTERNS" pt. 1 (of 3)

Certain questions have arisen since Venom's mysterious appearance at the Radar Station in Northern Canada. Like, how did he get there? Where's Eddie Brock? And, what turned this one- time "Lethal Protector" into a bloodthirsty homicidal maniac? The answers to these questions will be revealed with the help of a few guest stars.
name: Patterns, Part 1

description:
PATTERNS PART 2

The shocking truth behind Venom's resurgence is revealed! Surprisingly enough it involves Reed Richards.
name: Patterns, Part 2

description:
"PATTERNS" pt. 3 (of 3)

The true mastermind behind Venom's resurgence steps out of the shadows with the shocking revelation of the suit's origin.
name: Patterns, Part 3

description:
"Twist" (1 of 5)

It's symbiote vs. symbiote as two bloodthirsty Venom creatures go head-to-head - with Spider-Man caught in the middle of it all!
name: Twist, Part 1

description:
TWIST PART 2

The symbiote battle continues; will Spider-Man be able to neutralize two Venom-ous threats?
name: Twist, Part 2

description: The fan favorite team of writer Paul Jenkins and artist Humberto Ramos reteam for the newest ongoing series starring the Amazing Spider-Man. And the series kicks off with a bang, as Spidey faces off against his deadliest foe, Venom!
name: The Hunger Part 1 of 5
The Hunger Part 2 of 5

description: Spidey plays detective and tries to uncover the connection between Venom and his latest victims! Part 3 of the debut 5-issue story arc!
name: The Hunger Part 3 of 5

description: Still reeling from his last encounter with Venom, Spider-Man seeks out the help of the FANTASTIC FOUR.
name: The Hunger Part 4 of 5

description: Eddie Brock is dying. His cancer has caught up to him and Venom has finally lost his ideal host. As Spidey tries to understand why Eddie has hated him all these years, he's forced to make an ultimate decision... Should Spidey save Eddie's life - allowing Venom to live?
name: The Hunger Part 5 of 5

description: "COUNTDOWN" pts. 1 (of 5)-Doc Ock is out to destroy Spider-Man once and for all but this time he's doing it in style. Check out Humberto Ramos' cool new redesign of Spider-Man's most devious villain.
name: Countdown Part 1 of 5
Countdown Part 2 of 5

description: "COUNTDOWN" pt. 3 (of 5)?Doctor Octopus is out to ruin Spider-Man once and for all and has given the wall-crawler an ultimatum. For the safe release of the Palestinian ambassador, Spider-Man must reveal his identity to the entire world!
name: Countdown Part 3 of 5

description: "COUNTDOWN" pt. 4 (of 5) It's High Noon in Times Square as a defeated Spider- Man confronts Doc Ock, with countless innocent lives hanging in the balance!
name: Countdown Part 4 of 5

description: "COUNTDOWN" Concludes (5/5)! Spidey & Doc Ock face off in a titanic, action-packed throwdown! But will the wall-crawler be forced to disclose his true identity in order to preserve world peace?
name: Countdown Part 5 of 5

description: He's struggled for years to control the coiled reptile that dwells deep within his heart. But now, at the end of his rope, one bad day with change Dr. Curt Connors' life forever - and the Lizard will stalk the streets once more!
name: The Lizard's Tale Part 1

description: "THE LIZARD's TALE" pt. 3 (of 3)?As Curt Connors' self-destructive behavior escalates, Spidey must try to corral his out-of-control friend. But the Lizard may force the wall-crawler to kill, rather than cure!
name: The Lizard's Tale Part 3

description: A special fully painted stand-alone story! On a rooftop in the Bronx sits a sad handicapped man. A prisoner of his own crippled body, how will a battle between the wall-crawler and Morbius, the Living Vampire, change his life?

The web-slinger is confronted by an all-new menace -- one whose very presence causes his spider-sense to go bananas! Can even guest-star Captain America help turn the tide against this soldier from a different age? AND HOW WILL THESE EVENTS AFFECT THIS SUMMER'S AVENGERS EPIC, BEGINNING NEXT MONTH IN AVENGERS #500?
name: Under My Skin, Part 1

description: Mike Allred's Madman is back with a new adventure, The G-Men from Hell, and the action shows no signs of waning. After returning from his island adventure, Frank Einstein must renovate Dr. Boiffard's mansion, but before he can enjoy it, he has to save the people he least likes, namely Mike Mattress and his partner Crept. And what does mysterious benefactor Hugh Rodrigo have to do with this new mess? Secrets about Frank's true identity are bubbling up, but the truth might be too much for our long-john-wearin' hero. Written and illustrated by creator Mike Allred, with colors by Laura Allred.
name: The G-Men From Hell, Part 1

description: Is Frank Einstein dead -- again? Agents Mattress and Crept, a.k.a. The G-Men From Hell, are joined by a renegade Tri-Eye agent, Chow Skip Wang (who returns by popular request). The agents, whom Frank sought to save, must now return the favor and seek him in the treacherous Monstadt building. In the process, the mystery of the G-Men finally begins to unwind. How did they die and end up in Hell? How did they escape Hell? And how do they plan to stay out of Hell? Action and intrigue await you in the pages of this issue of Madman, all stunningly colored by Laura Allred. Don't miss out!
name: The G-Men From Hell, Part 2

description: Agents Mattress and Crept have joined forces with Triple-Eye agent, Chow Skip Wang, and are now deep in the bowels of the monstrous Monstadt building, struggling to save Frank Einstein, otherwise known as Madman. In this issue, the Agents reveal more of their past to Wang, and we get to see them on very first mission as (drumroll, please) ... The G-Men From Hell! This issue's back cover pinup art is by Peter Kuper!
name: The G-Men From Hell. Part 3

description: Agent Chow and the G-Men run head-on into Frank (Madman) Einstein's most sinister archenemy, the evil Mr. Monstadt, who is planning to use Frank for a human sacrifice, and our favorite hero is in need of a last-minute rescue. But even though the G-Men are uncharacteristically attempting to help Frank, there is little trust in the new partnership. And that puts our (new) heroes into further peril. Color by Laura Allred and back cover pinup art by Dan Clowes.
name: The G-Men From Hell, Part 4

description: The Cobra Island battle is over, but there's a lot of healing to do. As the Joes pay tribute to their fallen friends, Duke discovers a possible security breach. How far will he go to keep the team's secrets? How could a conspiracy geek named Scott Sturgis possibly be the most dangerous man on the planet? And who's the new guy?
name: Scott Sturgis is a Reasonable Man...

volume.name: G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero

description: When Cobra Commander and Storm Shadow come out of hiding in Tibet, the Joes make their bid to take them down. Once they arrive, however, Scarlett and the other Joes are shocked to see how far Snake-Eyes will go to bring his former sword brother to justice! Meanwhile, the Cobra forces led by Tomax and Xamot take a major step towards rebuilding their power base; and Destro makes a decision that may or may not be a surprise to everyone around him. All this and more in a story we could only call "The Paradigm Shift!"
name: Paradigm Shift

volume.name: G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero

description: "Players and Pawns" Part 1 of 6: While the Baroness chooses between love and duty, Cobra Commander and Destro make bold moves to secure their own positions. Meanwhile, Snake Eyes returns to face the repercussions of his drastic decision, the Joes have a graduation ceremony and some fresh faces join a new campaign against Cobra's forces. All this and Sierra Gordo under siege in Part 1 of the first full-length story arc!

volume.name: G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero

description: PLAYERS AND PAWNS: Part 2 (of 6), Cobra Commander has returned to power, but our heroes barely have time to worry about that! While Barrel Roll sneaks around on Cobra Island, the team regroups after a very public attack on their leadership. Elsewhere, Destro and his Iron Grenadiers prepare for their first major operation since leaving Cobra. Meanwhile, the jungles of Sierra Gordo are alive with the sound of combat as Recondo, Ripcord, Dart, Low-Light, and Tunnel Rat face down a group of high-tech commandos determined to leave the tiny nation in ruin. It's action in the jungle and manipulation in the shadows as "Players and Pawns" continues!
name: Players and Pawns: Part Two

volume.name: G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero

description: PLAYERS AND PAWNS: Part 3 (of 6), Cobra Commander has returned to power, but our heroes barely have time to worry about that! While Barrel Roll sneaks around on Cobra Island, the team regroups after a very public attack on their leadership. Elsewhere, Destro and his Iron Grenadiers prepare for their first major operation since leaving Cobra. Meanwhile, the jungles of Sierra Gordo are alive with the sound of combat as Recondo, Ripcord, Dart, Low-Light, and Tunnel Rat face down a group of high-tech commandos determined to leave the tiny nation in ruin. It's action in the jungle and manipulation in the shadows as "Players and Pawns" continues!
name: Players and Pawns Part Three

volume.name: G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero

description: All new continuity for G.I. Joe! G.I. Joe faces its first challenge as a team when COBRA threatens to turn the stolen Spectre warjet prototype against America herself,  to destroy the heart of the nation. But the team must identify this mysterious target before they can defend it. Has COBRA Commander targeted the nation's heart with the eyes of a madman, or a genius? And when these heroes make their stand against the weapon of the future, where will the ultimate victory be found? In the overwhelming technological superiority of the machine, or the heart and guts of the soldier?

"Overwatch." The stolen Black Dragon war drone has spearheaded Cobra's shock assault on Philadelphia,  the birthplace of American democracy. Now Cobra Commander unleashes a platoon of deadly urban combat specialists, the Street Vipers, to steal the Constitution itself. Outgunned and outnumbered, the G.I. Joe team fights to keep the heart of the nation out of Cobra Commander's ruthless hands,  only to face the ultimate betrayal, when a traitor shows the unsuspecting Joes where his true loyalty lies.

In this alternate universe, the Joe team tries to reform and retrain under multiple threats. Meanwhile, a traitor is in the ranks. 
 
Hawk continues to fight against charges of treason, and an apparent lull in COBRA's shadow war against the USA allows the Joes to begin to train together as a team... in the lush Hawaiian Islands. The training exercises that Beach Head has cooked up for the Joes promise to make their days and nights anything but heavenly. But Scarlett finds a shocking touch of paradise in the hellish grind ? in the arms of another Joe! And when the Joes have trained and strained to the limits of their endurance.

Few realize they even exist. Fewer still understand their full power. But now, the mysterious group Cobra is on the cusp of its greatest victory, one which will make Cobra Commander one of the planet's most powerful men. And when Stalker is captured by the wily Baroness, it seems that Cobra is destined to learn the secrets of the only real threat to its dominance, and Stalker himself is destined for decades of living death in a Cobra prison. Until Snake Eyes risks everything in a desperate attempt to settle an old debt of honor...

"ALLEGIANCE" Snake Eyes leads a COBRA raid on The Pit, G.I. Joe headquarters. Shattered by recent events, has the silent commando bought into the Cobra Revolution, or is there a darker, more personal motive behind his seeming betrayal of the Joes? And when his rival Duke's fate balances on the edge of his blade, where will the shadow warrior decide his ultimate allegiance lies?

name: Meet Me at the Corner of Hedgehog and Vine Part 1; Meet Me at the Corner of Hedgehog and Vine Part 2; You Bet My Life! Part 1; You Bet My Life! Part 2; Keep Looking Up!; Fast Food!

description:
Triple Trouble; Robotnik develops a new robot adversary for Sonic: a robot monkey who throws explosive coconuts. In The Beginning; Sonic presents humorous examples of rejected Sonic concepts. Vertigo A-Go-Go; While collecting magic rings, Sonic is transported to a strange dimension inhabited by two even stranger beings. All The Mail's About Tails. Scripts by Michael Gallagher, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Jon D'Agostino.

Introduction to Coconuts, Scratch, Grounder, Vertical and Horizontal.
name: Triple Trouble! Part 1; Triple Trouble! Part 2; Vertigo a' Go Go; Foiled Again!; Two-Timer! All the Mail's about Tails!

first_appearance_teams.name: Super Special Sonic Search and Smash Squad

team_credits.name: Super Special Sonic Search and Smash Squad

description: The Bomb Bugs Me! Tails Fairy Tales. Double Speak! Paper Trail! Rabbit Deployment! Rabbit Deployment! Scripts by Michael Gallagher, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Jon D'Agostino. Archie and the Gang Tell Us About Recycling Plastic Containers public service announcement starring Archie, Betty, and Veronica.

The Lizard Of Odd; Dr. Robotnik roboticizes a small lizard into a towering menace bent on destroying Sonic. Antoine's Vain Refrain. Horizont Al & Verti Cal. Bad-Niks Bazaar. Hair Styling. Tails' Little Tale; Tails tries to destroy one of Dr. Robotnik's factories without help from Sonic. Scripts by Michael Gallagher, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Scripts by Michael Gallagher, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Jon D'Agostino. Robotnik Birthday Card, art by Manak. Super Sonic Pin-Up, art by Manak.

Olympic Trials And Errors, script by Angelo DeCesare; Dr. Robotnik challenges the rebels to an Olympic-style games, promising to return the planet to normal should they win. Sonic's Ten Second Workout. Chomp On This, Chump; Dr. Robotnik sets a robot super-termite loose to destroy the forest hiding place of Sonic and his friends. Fast Food. Pencils by Manak, inks by Jon D'Agostino.

The Spin Doctor, script by Michael Gallagher, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Henry Scarpelli; Sonic invades Dr. Robotnik's volcano fortress to stop his latest scheme. Here Comes The Bribe, pencils by Manak, inks by Scarpelli. Sonic's Christmas Carol, script by Angelo DeCesare, pencils by Manak, inks by Henry Scarpelli; A retelling of the Dickens classic, Sonic style.

Uncle Chuck's Treasure, script by Angelo DeCesare; The Freedom Fighters scour the remains of Mobius Natural Park for a treasure chest hidden by Sonic's Uncle Chuck, but lying in wait for when they find it is Dr. Robotnik. The Shadow Nose. Details Are Sketchy. Sorceress In Distress; Dr. Robotnik mistakes Sally in a Halloween costume for a genuine sorceress and whisks her away to his robot factory to begin courting her. Princess Cruises.

'Bots All, Folks, script by Michael Gallagher; Dr. Robotnik's latest creation, a robot that resembles Batman, takes on Sonic. A Little Sonic Goes A Long Way; The freedom fighters search for a safe place to play music.

Pseudo-Sonic; Dr. Robotnik creates a robot duplicate of Sonic in order to infiltrate the freedom fighters. Tooth Or Consequences. Quick Sketch. What's The Point?; Sally refuses to allow Sonic to keep a Mobian Needle Bird in the rebel headquarters, until the bird proves its worth. The All New, Pumped-Up, Sonic The Hedgehog Pin-up. Scripts by Michael Gallagher, pencils by Manak, inks by Henry Scarpelli.

Revenge Of The Nerbs, script by Angelo DeCesare, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Art Mawhinney; While trying to sabotage the electric system of a Robot Plant, Sonic and the Freedom Fighters encounter an underground race that calls itself Nerbs. 'Twan With The Wind, script by Angelo DeCesar, art by Art Mawhinney; Antoine tries to convince the Freedom Fighters that hot air balloons can be of use in the war against Dr. Robotnik.

The Good, The Bad, And The Hedgehog, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Art Mawhinney; Sonic gets lost on the Cosmic Interstate and ends up on a world where Dr. Robotnik is a gentle physician and the world is menaced by Dark Sonic and his gang. Beat The Clock, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Art Mawhinney; Coconuts captures the Freedom Fighters to bait a trap for Sonic in order to impress Dr. Robotnik. Food For Thought or You Are What You Eat, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, art by Art Mawhinney; After eating too many chili dogs, Sonic dreams that he and the freedom fighters are food and Dr. Robotnik is an evil chef.

The Good The Bad and the Hedgehog: Sonic goes to morality flipped world of Mobius and meets Anti Sonic the two fight each other.

Food for thought: sonic had a weird dream after eating too many chili-dogs
name: The Good The Bad And The Hedgehog

description: A Timely Arrival, script by Michael Gallagher, art by Art Mawhinney; Dr. Robotnik invents a time machine to send Sonic into the past and out of his hair. The Bold-Headed Eagle, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Rich Kozlowski; Sonic encounters what may be the last living eagle on Moebius. The Lynx Is A Jinx, script by Angelo DeCesare, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Rich Kozlowski; The Freedom Fighters want nothing to do with a bad-luck lynx that Sonic has befriended.

The Island Hedgehog, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Jon D'Agostino; Dr. Robotnik maneuvers Sonic and Tails into fighting Knuckles, the guardian of the Floating Island, so he can steal the Chaos Emerald from the island in the confusion. Space In Yo' Face, script by Angelo DeCesare, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Jon D'Agostino; The Freedom Fighters attempt to sabotage Dr. Robotnik's new robot space craft.

The Island Hedgehog Part 1: Sonic and Tails get Knuckles hostile Angel Island welcome

SPACE IN YO’ FACE: the Freedom Fighters must stop Robonik from roboticizing the entire planet Mobius in space

Tails' Taste Of Power, script by Angelo DeCesare, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Jon D'Agostino; Tails accidentally eats a piece of fruit from the Moebian Tree Of Knowledge and develops a genius intellect. Do-It-Yourself Sonic, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Harvey Mercadoocasio; Three pages of blank art are provided and readers are invited to create their own dialogue fitting the action and submit it to Archie Comics as a contest entry. Girls Just Wanna Have Fun, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Harvey Mercadoocasio; Dr. Robotnik attempts to separate the female Freedom Fighters from Sonic, thinking that they'll be easier targets without the hedgehog's aid.

Rockin' The 'Bot, script by Angelo DeCesare, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Harvey Mercadoocasio; As a reward for saving his life, a frog gives Sonic three mystical stones that will each endow him with a temporary special power. What's The Big Idea?, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Harvey Mercadoocasio; otor locks himself in his lab and the Freedom Fighters speculate on what project he's working on. Animal Magnetism, script by Angelo DeCesare, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Jon D'Agostino; Dr. Robotnik attempts to capture Bunnie using a giant robot with a powerful magnet.

Sonic Under Glass, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Jon D'Agostino; Dr. Robotnik traps Sonic and the Freedom Fighters in virtual reality technology, in a program that grants each victim their fondest wishes. The Man From H.E.D.G.E.H.O.G., script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Jon D'Agostino; Dr. Robotnik suspects a mole in his organization is tipping the Freedom Fighters to his plans.

Gorilla Warfare or The Apes Of Wrath, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Harvey Mercadoocasio [as Harvey M.]; Dr. Robotnik sends a giant robot ape against Sonic and the Freedom Fighters. First Star I See Tonight, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Jon D'Agostino; Princess Sally finds a glowing orb that she feels may be the key to defeating Dr. Robotnik and rescuing her father from his dimensional exile.

Wedding Bell Blues, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Harvey Mercadoocasio [as Harvey M.]; Dr. Robotnik launches an all-out attack on what looks like the wedding day of Sonic and Princess Sally. In The Still Of The Night, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Jon D'Agostino; Princess Sally is summoned to the deathbed of her governess, Julayla, in order to pass one final test.
name: Wedding Bell Blues

description:
Night Of 1000 Sonics, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Dave Manak (pgs 1-12) and Art Mawhinney (pgs 13-24), inks by Rich Koslowski; The appearance of a dimensional portal prods Sonic into collecting Sonics from differing dimensional planes to carry out an all-out war on Dr. Robotnik; But the portal also unleashes something even worse onto Moebius.

Sonic teams up with multiverse versions of himself and Robotnik to stop Anti Sonic and Robo-Robotnik v.1 from taking over the multiverse.
name: Night of 1000 Sonics

description:
That's The Spirit!, script by Angelo DeCesare, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Harvey Mercadoocasio [as Harvey M.]; An explosion in one of Dr. Robotnik's labs leaves Sonic invisible and intangible, and leaves everyone else with the impression that he's dead. Deadliest Of The Species, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Rich Koslowski; On a solo mission of sabotage, Sally encounters someone with an agenda of his own.

Thats the Spirit: after surviving Death trap sonic is thought to be dead but has became invisible

A Princess Sally Adventure 'Deadliest of the Spiciest' Prologue: Sally works to destroy on of Robotnik's base
Phases Of E.V.E.; Dr. Robotnik creates a robot with the capacity to evolve both physically and mentally, and sends the creation after Sonic; Snively, Tails, and E.V.E. guest-star.

The Return, script by Ken Penders, pencils by Pat Spaziante, inks by Harvey Mercadoocasio [as Harvey M.]; E.V.E.'s energy burst flung Dr. Robotnik into a parallel time line; There he conspires with his roboticized alternate self to return to his own time line and gain revenge against Sonic. Tails' Knighttime Story, script by Angelo DeCesare, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Jon D'Agostino; Sally tells Tails a story about Sir Runalot versus the evil Sir Knightmare, hoping the story will convince him not to emulate Sonic until he's more experienced.
name: The Return

description: Ivo Robotnik, Freedom Fighter, script by Angelo DeCesare, pencils by Dave Manak , inks by Rich Koslowski; The Freedom Fighters and Dr. Robotnik are captured by an alien artificial intelligence, who intends to study them in an artificial terrarium aboard his space ship. The top three winning entries in the "Do-It-Yourself Sonic Contest" are reprinted. Vol-ANT-teer, script by Angelo DeCesare, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Jon D'Agostino; Antoine agrees to help Tails search Robotopolis for a missing power ring, while Bunnie surreptitiously helps them out.

When Hedgehogs Collide, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Dave Manak (pgs 1-11) and Art Mawhinney (pgs 12-24), inks by Harvey Mercadoocasio [as HARVO] (pgs 1-11) and Rich Koslowski (pgs 12-24); Evil Sonic discovers the dimensional pathway to Sonic's dimension, where he and his gang begin sowing seeds of mayhem and destruction.

Sonic returns along with his evil gang the Freedom Fighters.
name: Evil Sonic Is Back

description: Go Ahead...Mecha My Day, script by Michael Gallagher, pencils by Pat Spaziante, inks by Harvey Mercadoocasio; Dr. Robotnik abducts Tails and Amy Rose, Sonic's biggest fan, as bait to lure Sonic into the dimensional pathway, where an unseen adversary awaits.

Way, Way Past Cool, pencils by Dave Manak; Dr. Robotnik uses a climate change beam to send Moebius into sub-zero temperatures in order to flush out the Freedom Fighters. Fortified, script by Angelo DeCesare, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Rich Koslowski; Dr. Robotnik traps the Freedom Fighters in an old log fort atop a mountain.

Way Way Past Cool: Robotnik prepare to freeze land. Freedom fighters must train to adapt the change in the environment

Fortified: Freedom Fighters defend against Robotnik newest Deforesting machine
name: Way Past Cool

description:
A Scrambled Hedgehog, script by Ken Penders, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Rich Koslowski; An amnesiac Sonic is convinced by Dr. Robotnik that the Freedom Fighters are his enemies.

The cover to this issue pays homage to The Amazing Spider-Man #56.

Sonic lost his memory and is now working with robotnik to find the Freedom Fighters' base
name: A Scrambled Hedgehog

description:
Saturday Night's Alright For A Fight, script by Ken Penders, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Rich Koslowski; Sonic takes on the entire assemblage of Freedom Fighters, thinking that they're his enemies; Meanwhile, Dr. Robotnik has planted a transmitter on Sonic, hoping to learn the location of the Freedom Fighters' secret base. Growing Pains, script by Michael Gallagher, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Harvey Mercadoocasio [as HARVO]; Determined to prove his prowess to Sonic, Tails goes off on his own to attack Dr. Robotnik; Along the way, he encounters a lovely female fox being held captive on a small island.

Saturday Nights Fights: part one and two: With Sonic’s memory gone he fights the Freedom fighters

Growing pains: angered that Sonic beating him up during the last issue and the Freedom Fighters treating like a child ,he sets of alone until he found damsel in distress.
name: Saturday Night's Alright For a Fight!

description:
STEEL BELTED SALLY: Sally get roboticized in order to trick Robotnik and destroy his headquarters.

GROWING PAINS: is the dark conclusion for Tails second solo. He must avoid being captured by his first love aka Autofiona
name: Steel-Belted Sally

description:
The Return Of Uncle Chuck, script by Angelo DeCesare, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Jon D'Agostino; A lab accident traps Dr. Robotnik in the trans-dimensional void, emboldening Snively to attempt his own attacks on Sonic and the Freedom Fighters; It also restores Uncle Chuck's organic brain to control of his robotic body, allowing him to act as a spy within the Robotnik headquarters. Who Keeps Stealing My Chaos Emeralds?, script by Paul Castiglia, pencils by Pat Spaziante, inks by Brian Thomas; Someone is stealing chaos emeralds from Dr. Robotnik's secret cache. He assigns Coconuts to track down and eliminate the culprit.

Return of Uncle Chuck: Chuck must stop Snively but in order to so he must reveal himself

Who Keep Stealing my Chaos Emeralds: Coconuts seeks to stop the one who stealing the emeralds from Robotnik
name: The Return of Uncle Chuck

description:
A Robot Rides The Rails, script by Ken Penders, pencils by Ken Penders, inks by Jon D'Agostino; The Freedom Fighters try to get intelligence on a new robot weapon that Dr. Robotnik is shipping via high speed train; But the rivalry between Sonic and Geoffrey St. John begins to interfere with the mission. Lost...And Found, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Ken Penders, inks by Jon D'Agostino; While Knuckles searches for the missing Chaotix, he doesn't realize that he's under surveillance. Tundra Road, Part 1, script by Michael Gallagher, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Rich Koslowski; Rotor answers a distress call from his North Sea homeland and finds Dr. Robotnik has taken it over.

A Robot Rides the Rails: sally seeks infromation and to sabotage Robotnik supply train

Lost... and Found: Knuckles seeks to find his missing teammates

Tundra Road: after listening disress call from home rotor return to see what is the problem.
name: A Robot Rides the Rails

description:
Blast From The Past; The Freedom Fighters discover a prehistoric Moebian suspended in ice; They attempt to revive him while being stalked by a squadron of Swat Bots, led by Sonic's roboticized dog, Muttski. Prisoners, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, art by Ken Penders; The Chaotix team discover who has taken them captive. Tundra Road, Part 2, script by Michael Gallagher, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Rich Koslowski; Rotor and some of the Arctic Freedom Fighters foment insurrection in the captive provinces of the arctic region of Moebius.

Blast From the Past: Freedom fighter Discover a cavmen (sort of). they revive him and he cause massive trouble

"Knuckles solo story inside!"

Tundra Road: Rotor was rescued by Agustus and Sealia. with their help can they rescue Rotor's herd

Sonic shrinks himself into Rotor's bloodstream to combat a virulent virus planted in the Freedom Fighters by Dr. Robotnik. The Big Picture, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Ken Penders, inks by Harvey Mercadoocasio [as HARVO]; The mysterious watcher tracks Knuckles' path toward Revelation. Sonic Shot, script and pencils by Ken Penders, inks by Jon D'Agostino; Snively challenges the Freedom Fighters to a friendly game of hockey. But Dr. Robotnik quickly intercedes and ups the stakes.

Sonic The Hedgehog in let's get small: sonic travel in rotor to get battle against parasite

The Big Picture!: someone is spying on knuckles and figuring out what to do with him

Sonic Shot: Freedom fighters play hockey with Snively and Swatbots
name: Let's Get Small

description:
Dulcy overhears Dr. Robotnik's invasion plans and races to tell the Freedom Fighters; Meanwhile, Robotnik discovers that Uncle Chuck and Muttski have regained control of their robot forms and reasserts his control. A Sense Of History, Part 1, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Ken Penders, inks by Jon D'Agostino; Knuckles' search for Archimedes causes him to recall how the floating island of the Echidnas came to be.

To 'Bot or Not To' Bot: the freedom fighter plan a sabtoge on Robotnik newest creation the combots

A Sense of History Part 1: the origin of echidnapolis
name: To 'Bot or not to' Bot

description:
Ring Of Truth, script by Micheal Gallagher, pencils by Dave Manak, inks by Rich Koslowski; When Sonic captures his billionth magic ring, he is hurled into a mystical dimension and subjected to a series of tests by the Ancient Walkers. A Sense Of History, Part 2, script and pencils by Ken Penders, inks by Jon D'Agostino; Knuckles recalls a past event, in which two brothers seek to siphon off the energy of the chaos emeralds holding the Floating Island aloft, allowing it to return to the planet.

Ring of truth: Sonic collected a billion rings and is now meeting with the Ancient Walkers.

A Sense of History: The origin of Dimitri.
name: Ring of Truth; A Sense of History Part II

description: Heart Of Darkness, script by Ken Penders, pencils by Art Mawhinney, inks by Harvey Mercadoocasio [as HARVO]; Sonic leads an expedition of Freedom Fighters into the Zone Of Silence in search of an anomaly which may lead them to the whereabouts of Sally's exiled father, King Maximillian Acorn. A Sense Of History, Part 3, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Ken Penders, inks by Jon D'Agostino; Dmitri succumbs to the lure of power and becomes a living Chaos Emerald.
name: Heart of Darkness

description: The Day Robotropolis Fell, script by Angelo DeCesare, art by Brian Thomas; When Dr. Robotnik evacuates from Robotropolis ahead of an impending earthquake, Sonic and Sally see this as an opportunity to sabotage as much of Robotnik's operation as possible before the quake hits. Bunnie's Worst Nightmare, script and art by Rich Koslowski; Bunnie's fear that she will eventually be completely roboticized may be happening.
name: The Day Robotropolis Fell

description: The Rise Of Robotropolis, The Fall Of Sonic, script by Kent Taylor, pencils by Manny Galan, inks by Phil Sheehy; A confluence of circumstances dampens Sonic's speed; He and the Freedom Fighters go in search of Magic Rings to restore the speed, but instead fall into the hands of Dr. Robotnik's Swatbots, forcing Sonic to choose between saving his friends and restoring his speed. Bedtime Tails, script by Mike Kanterovich and Ken Penders, pencils by Ken Penders, inks by Jon D'Agostino; To entertain a convalescing Sonic, Tails reads him a story from the fan comic that he produced, a story that sounds suspiciously like the origin of the Fantastic Four and their battle with Galactus, but with Sonic and the Freedom Fighters as the leads.
name: The Fall of Sonic

description: Rage Against The Machine, script by Michael Gallagher, pencils by Pat Spaziante, inks by Brian Thomas; Sonic is ambushed and delivered to Dr. Robotnik, where he's roboticized into Mecha-Sonic. This story continues in Sonic & Knuckles: Mecha Madness #1.
